title: Introducing: Stefan Noons
body:
Big shout out to When The Gramophone Rings for spotting this one, else it might have just sat in my ever-more crowded inbox.

Describing his main influence as _‘_\[listening to\] ‘Heaven or Las Vegas’ on repeat endlessly as I farmed for experience points on Final Fantasy VIII’__ , Edinburgh resident **Stefan Noon’s** debut track _Riverine _flaunts these proudly: the woozy, dreamy pop of **Slowdive** and the carefully constructed (yet accessible) orchestration of **Nobuo Uematsu** (FYI, the FF8 soundtrack was his best work. Don’t argue).

But it’s his vocals that really grab your attention, hinting towards a younger, less-tormented **Jamie Stewart**; a comparison even more audible on follow up track _Signals._

This is carefully constructed, recorded and produced music that you need to hear.
